page.title: 17TRANSPORT IN CHITTERNE
page.content: The only public transport serving the area is a single deck bus which runs between Chitterne and Warminster, via Codford on Tuesday, Thursday, Friday and Saturday, leaving at 9.O5 a.m., returning from Warminster at 11.55 a.m. On Friday there is an additional service in the afternoon, leaving at 1.3O p.m., returning at 5 p.m. To travel to other places connecting bus services are available, though not very frequent, at Codford and Warminster. Anyone working away has to have their own transport, consequently many families have two or more cars. Traffic problems through Chitterne are caused by heavy stone carrying lorries speeding through the village on the B39O road.
